channel.title: NPR Topics: Culture
channel.description: Art and entertainment commentary plus interviews, book reviews, movie reviews, music reviews, comedy, and visual art. Subscribe to podcasts and follow trends in music, painting, art, architecture, photography, and design.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Sunday Puzzle: New newsmakers of 2025
item.description: NPR's Ayesha Rascoe plays the puzzle with KNPR listener Calvin Siemer of Henderson, Nev., and Weekend Edition Puzzlemaster Will Shortz.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Ayesha Rascoe plays the puzzle with KNPR listener Calvin Siemer of Henderson, Nev., and Weekend Edition Puzzlemaster Will Shortz.
item.dc:creator: Will Shortz

item.title: 'Wait Wait' for January 3, 2026: Happy New Year!
item.description: This week, we anticipate good things for 2026 by reminding ourselves about all the fun we had in 2025, with special guests Pedro Pascal, Chris Perfetti, and Heather Gay
item.content:encoded:
This week, we anticipate good things for 2026 by reminding ourselves about all the fun we had in 2025, with special guests Pedro Pascal, Chris Perfetti, and Heather Gay

(Image credit: David Jon)

item.title: Hunting for Pokemon cards? Maybe skip stores and try a card show
item.description: Pokemon cards are having a moment, making it hard to find them in stores and at fair prices. Collectors say going to a card show is one way to find cards and fair prices.
item.content:encoded: Pokemon cards are having a moment, making it hard to find them in stores and at fair prices. Collectors say going to a card show is one way to find cards and fair prices.
item.dc:creator: Vincent Acovino

item.title: What worked — and what didn't — in the 'Stranger Things' finale
item.description: Between the final battle and some key needle drops, there was a little too much talking.
item.content:encoded:
Between the final battle and some key needle drops, there was a little too much talking.

(Image credit: Netflix)
item.dc:creator: Linda Holmes

item.title: George Clooney gets French citizenship — and another dust-up with Trump
item.description: The French government says it granted George and Amal Clooney citizenship because of their contributions to its international influence. Their family has primarily lived in France since 2021.
item.content:encoded:
The French government says it granted George and Amal Clooney citizenship because of their contributions to its international influence. Their family has primarily lived in France since 2021.

(Image credit: Henry Nicholls)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: Tips from Life Kit to set you up for success in 2026
item.description: Sometimes life can get in the way of meeting our ambitions. NPR's Life Kit podcast host Marielle Segarra gives us some practical, daily life tips to set us up for success in 2026.
item.content:encoded: Sometimes life can get in the way of meeting our ambitions. NPR's Life Kit podcast host Marielle Segarra gives us some practical, daily life tips to set us up for success in 2026.
item.dc:creator: Scott Detrow

item.title: Author John Green talks about living with obsessive compulsive disorder
item.description: On Wild Card, famous guests answer the kinds of questions we often think about but don't talk about. Author John Green reflects on living with obsessive compulsive disorder.
item.content:encoded: On Wild Card, famous guests answer the kinds of questions we often think about but don't talk about. Author John Green reflects on living with obsessive compulsive disorder.

item.title: Dry January started with 1 person years ago – now its a phenom
item.description: Dry January is the practice of not drinking for the first month of the new year. But where did the practice come from?
item.content:encoded:
Dry January is the practice of not drinking for the first month of the new year. But where did the practice come from?

(Image credit: FRED TANNEAU/AFP via Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Jaclyn Diaz

item.title: Guides to help you tackle your New Year's resolutions
item.description: From building your strength to tackling credit card debt, NPR's Life Kit has a newsletter journey to help you tackle your New Year's resolution.
item.content:encoded: From building your strength to tackling credit card debt, NPR's Life Kit has a newsletter journey to help you tackle your New Year's resolution.
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: A big break after age 40 is possible. Just ask Jeff Hiller of 'Somebody Somewhere'
item.description: Hiller spent years scraping by in Hollywood before landing the role of Jeff on Somebody Somewhere. His memoir is Actress of a Certain Age. Originally broadcast Aug. 12, 2025.
item.content:encoded: Hiller spent years scraping by in Hollywood before landing the role of Jeff on Somebody Somewhere. His memoir is Actress of a Certain Age. Originally broadcast Aug. 12, 2025.
item.dc:creator: Terry Gross
